body_html: @raninbowlalala @HimariO I debugged a lot and found out the source of the issue, but have no solution yet. The issue happens when you want to create an evaluation graph and you don't want to have "is_training=True" hence you won't have variables like moving variance. For right now, I just turn off eval graph when I want to quantize, but that's just a workaournd. Any idea what to do to have an eval graph and be able to quantize as well?

body: @raninbowlalala @HimariO I debugged a lot and found out the source of the issue, but have no solution yet. The issue happens when you want to create an evaluation graph and you don't want to have "is_training=True" hence you won't have variables like moving variance. For right now, I just turn off eval graph when I want to quantize, but that's just a workaournd. Any idea what to do to have an eval graph and be able to quantize as well?
